ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence my decisions and treatment of others through thoughts that seek to exalt myself above them?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.question: Did my ambition to advance in career or maintain my current position influence my decisions and treatment of others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

oppression.question: Have I unjustly used my power, authority, or influence to mistreat others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

of their stories , ideas , or accomplishments
rather than engaging with them on a deeper level
lust.question: Did I reduce others to mere observers of their stories, ideas, or accomplishments, rather than engaging with them on a deeper level?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

as full human beings created in God 's image
lust.question: Did I reduce others to their usefulness, rather than seeing them as full human beings created in God's image?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

autonomy.question: Did I attribute my success and good things in life solely to my own efforts, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence and blessings?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted my successes in life, attributing them solely to my own abilities rather than acknowledging God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking to others using language that was not respectful of their dignity
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in speaking to others using language that was not respectful of their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking to others with words that were lacking in respect for their dignity

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others with hurtful, shameful words that violate their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it comes to sweet treats and beverages that are high in sugar?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, perhaps while enjoying time at home or during leisure activities?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking to an unhealthy extent
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking to an unhealthy extent, neglecting my responsibility to care for myself and be a good steward of God's gifts?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, especially when engaging in conversations about family, friends, or community events?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I choose to work on Sunday when it otherwise could have been avoided, thereby violating its sanctity and rest?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
